examples: On 2nd May we entrained for Dieppe.
The night of the next day, we entrained.

body_content.explanation: to cause something to happen, or to be caused by something:
examples: September 11 entrained a kind of moral crash worldwide.
The argument had entrained from an experiment that went horribly wrong.

body_content.explanation: to make something part of a liquid or flow of something and carry it along:
examples: A depression over Biscay entrained a blast of cold air to western areas.
A spray of water droplets from the splash becomes entrained in the airflow.

body_content.explanation: to make something have the same pattern or rhythm as something else:
examples: Daily injections of melatonin given at 3.30 each afternoon entrained the rats to a 24 hour cycle.
I believe that the harp has a particular influence on the nervous system so that we entrain to it more strongly than, say, the violin.
